Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Champacyclin (natural AMPs; Ile-rich; bacteria; prokaryotes. XXC; XXD; UCBB1ad)
Sequence Information.Source: marine sediments of the Gotland Deep (Baltic Sea),Streptomyces champavatii

Literature Information.Literature: This head-to-tail cyclic peptide is likely synthesized by a non-ribosomal peptide synthetase (NRPS) since F4, L5, A7 and I8 are all D-amino acids.Activity: Active against C. glabrata and E. amylovora (at 25 uM). E. amylovora is responsible for Fire blight (fireblight) that is a contagious disease affecting apples, pears, etc.
Literature Information.Author: Pesic A, Baumann HI, Kleinschmidt K, Ensle P, Wiese J, SÃ¼ssmuth RD, Imhoff JF.2013
Literature Information.Title: Champacyclin, a new cyclic octapeptide from streptomyces strain c42 isolated from the baltic sea.
